intro: Antiphytum heliotropioides, commonly known as the sun-like antiphytum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Antiphytum heliotropioides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
